camel.sink.path.routeId.name: camel.sink.path.routeId
camel.sink.path.routeId.description: The Route ID. Default value notice: The ID will be auto-generated if not provided

camel.sink.endpoint.block.name: camel.sink.endpoint.block
camel.sink.endpoint.block.description: If sending a message to a direct endpoint which has no active consumer, then we can tell the producer to block and wait for the consumer to become active.

camel.sink.endpoint.failIfNoConsumers.name: camel.sink.endpoint.failIfNoConsumers
camel.sink.endpoint.failIfNoConsumers.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception, when sending to a kamelet endpoint with no active consumers.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: The timeout value to use if block is enabled.

camel.component.kamelet.block.name: camel.component.kamelet.block
camel.component.kamelet.block.description: If sending a message to a kamelet endpoint which has no active consumer, then we can tell the producer to block and wait for the consumer to become active.

camel.component.kamelet.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.kamelet.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.kamelet.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.kamelet.timeout.name: camel.component.kamelet.timeout
camel.component.kamelet.timeout.description: The timeout value to use if block is enabled.

camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
